about.label: About the congress
about.p1: The International Society on Toxinology (IST), founded in 1962, promotes scientific advancement in all areas of toxinology, encompassing venomous and poisonous animals, plants and microorganisms, derived toxins, envenomations, antivenom development and therapeutic and biotechnological applications of toxins. The Society connects researchers worldwide through periodic meetings that stimulate the exchange of ideas, results and collaborations.
about.p2Start: In 2026, the 23rd World Congress of the International Society on Toxinology arrives in Manaus, Amazonas, for the first time in the Brazilian Amazon, a region of extraordinary biological diversity and high incidence of accidents caused by venomous animals. With the theme
about.p2Theme: "Toxinology, health and the Amazon: Sharing experiences between clinical practice, fundamental research and innovation"
about.p2End: , the congress proposes an international meeting of academic excellence, inclusive, diverse and attentive to ethical aspects.
about.p3: The event will bring together scientists interested in animal biology, biochemical characterization and mechanisms of action of toxins, pathophysiology of envenomations, development of treatments and new drug candidates based on toxins, articulating basic research, innovation and clinical practice from the perspective of One Health.

program.label: Preliminary program
program.item1: Opening ceremony including a lecture and tribute to the outstanding scientist in the field selected by IST and by previously honored scientists.
program.item3: 16 sessions, with 5 presentations: 1 main lecture of 20 min, 3 invited speakers with 15 min presentations, one of them being a young scientist, and 1 oral presentation of 10 min of a work selected from the submitted abstracts, with extra time for questions.
program.item4: 2 poster sessions at prime times, with presentation and evaluation of the works, subject to awards.
program.item6: Sociocultural interaction activities including the official dinner and an immersion through the scenery and cultural biodiversity of the Amazon.

committee.label: Scientific committee
committee.intro: The scientific committee brings together specialists from different continents, working in institutions of excellence and on multiple fronts of toxinology, from basic research to clinical and biotechnological applications.

venue.label: Event venue
venue.p1: The congress will be held at Hotel Tropical, in Manaus, combining infrastructure for large events with direct contact with Amazon nature. The privileged location favors both scientific activities and cultural and environmental immersion experiences.

registration.label: Registration
registration.subtitle: We're preparing everything for you! Registration will open soon with fees, modalities and complete schedule.
registration.p1: Registration modalities will include professionals, students, IST members and other participants, with differentiated fees by category and date ranges (early, regular and late).
registration.p2: Guidelines for abstract submission and presentation modalities will also be announced soon.
